projectDesc.p: To the tune “Bodhisattva Barbarian”—"The Wind is Gentle" is part of The Global Medieval Sourcebook, a digital compendium of medieval texts in their original languages and in English translation. This larger project comprises computer-readable transcriptions and/or editions of texts dating from the ninth to the sixteenth century, and originating in Europe, North Africa, the Middle East, and Asia; accompanied by new English translations; high-resolution digital images of manuscript/early print sources, where available; an apparatus that includes critical introductions, textual notes and annotations; and a flexible user interface with which to navigate these materials.

interpretation.p: Texts are translated into modern English with maximum fidelity to the original text, except where it would impair comprehension or good style. Archaisms are preserved where they do not conflict with the aesthetic of the original text. Creative translation choices are marked and discussed in the critical notes.

app.rdg: To the tune “Bodhisattva Barbarian”—"The Wind is Gentle"
The wind is gentle, the sunlight soft; it is still early spring.
Quickly putting on my double-layered coat, I am in a good mood.
As I rise, I feel a slight chill.
The plum blossom is smudged into my hair.
Only in drunkenness could I forget.
I lit the incense before I lay down.
The incense smoke has all disappeared, but the wine has not yet gone.
